Coordinate system for position. A Script MetadataCoordSys enum. Observed is refracted apparent topocentric, e.g. similar to Mount but the telescope model is applied and the azimuth is wrapped. If None then position should be ignored.
Longitude, latitude axes of position in coordinateSystem

Rotation system for cameraAngle, a Script MetadataRotSys enum * None: The camera rotator is not used; ignore cameraAngle. * Sky: Position angle of focal plane +Y, measured from N through E. At 0 degrees, +Y is along N and +X is along E/W depending on handedness. At 90 degrees, +Y is along E and +X is along S/N depending on handedness. * Horizon: Position angle of focal plane +Y, measured from +Alt through +Az. At 0 degrees, +Y is along +Alt and +X is along +/-Az, depending on handedness. At 90 degrees, +Y is along +Az and +X is along -/+Alt, depending on handedness. * Mount: The position sent to the instrument rotator; the details depend on the rotator.

When the script process started. 0 before the process is started.
When script configuration began. 0 before configuration begins.
When script configuration finished (succeeded or failed). 0 before configuration ends.
When the script was told to run. 0 before the script is told to run.
When the script process ended. This is also approximately the time at which the script stopped running, if it was ever run. 0 before the script process ends.

State of script process; a ScriptProcessState enum. Loading means the script is still being loaded and is not yet configured. Configured means the script has been configured and can be run. Running means the script has been commanded to run. Done means the script has finished (see scriptState to see whether it ran successfully). ConfigureFailed means the process was terminated because the `configure` command failed. Terminated means the process was terminated due to calling the `terminate` command, or due to calling the `stop` command when the script was not running or if running but stopping the script gently failed.
State of the script; a ScriptState enum from Script_Events.xml; 0 if the script is not yet loaded.
